Oneness.quote: "That thou art - Tat tvam asi." (Chandogya Upanishad 6.8.7)

Transcendence.quote: "Brahman is beyond mind and speech." (Kena Upanishad 1.3)

Immanence.quote: "The Self is everywhere, bright, bodiless, whole." (Isha Upanishad 8)

Non-Duality.quote: "There is no diversity here at all." (Brihadaranyaka Upanishad 4.4.19)

Self-Knowledge.quote: "By knowing Brahman one becomes Brahman." (Mundaka Upanishad 3.2.9)

Attributes.quote: "Neither gross nor subtle, neither short nor long." (Brihadaranyaka Upanishad 3.8.8)

Manifestation.quote: "From Brahman come all these beings." (Taittiriya Upanishad 3.1)

Eternal Nature.quote: "Brahman is without beginning or end." (Bhagavad Gita 13.12)

Universal Self.quote: "The Self in all beings and all beings in the Self." (Isha Upanishad 6)

Unknowable.quote: "That from which words return along with the mind." (Taittiriya Upanishad 2.4.1)

Omnipresence.quote: "Brahman fills all space like salt dissolved in water." (Chandogya Upanishad 6.13)

Liberation.quote: "Knowledge of Brahman leads to immediate liberation." (Brahma Sutras 1.1.4)

Beyond Attributes.quote: "Neither this nor that - neti neti." (Brihadaranyaka Upanishad 2.3.6)

Supreme Goal.quote: "Knowing Brahman one attains the Supreme." (Taittiriya Upanishad 2.1)

Cosmic Source.quote: "From which all beings are born." (Taittiriya Upanishad 3.1)

Infinite Being.quote: "Infinite is Brahman, infinite is Atman." (Brihadaranyaka Upanishad 5.1)
